pp

Class PP

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • pp.PP
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class PP
extends java.lang.Thread
    PP class enables to manage communication with the game and gives access to the data of the game.
    Author:
    Mathieu Muratet

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Close Prog&Play API when the jvm stop. This method makes sure of PP is correctly closed by the user and closes it if not.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread
        See Also:
        close()

      • open

        public void open()
          throws PPException
        Opens Prog&Play API. This must be called before using other functions in this library.
        Throws:
        PPException - on errors linked with Prog&Play.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws PPException
        Shutdown and cleanup Prog&Play API. After calling this Prog&Play functions should not be used. You may, of course, use PP_Open to use the functionality again.
        Throws:
        PPException - on errors linked with Prog&Play.

      • isGameOver

        public boolean isGameOver()
                   throws PPException
        Returns:
        true if the game is ended and false if not.
        Throws:
        PPException - on errors linked with Prog&Play.

        public java.awt.geom.Point2D getSpecialAreasPosition(int z)
                                              throws java.lang.InstantiationException,
                                                     PPException
        Parameters:
        num - id of a special area, it must be included meanwhile [0;n[ where n is the number of special areas returned by getNumSpecialAreas.
        Returns:
        the position of this special area on success.

        public int getResource(int id)
                throws PPException
        Parameters:
        id - id of resource that you want know level.
        Returns:
        the current level of "id" resource.
        Throws:

      • getNumUnits

        public int getNumUnits(PP.Coalition c)
                throws PPException
        Returns the number of units from the "c" coalition. Only visible units by the player are counted.
        Parameters:
        c - coalition to consult.
        Returns:
        the number of units (visible by the player) from this coalition.
        Throws:
        PPException - on errors linked with Prog&Play.

      • getUnitAt

        public Unit getUnitAt(PP.Coalition c,
             int i)
               throws PPException
        Returns the nth visible unit of the "c" coalition.
        Parameters:
        c - coalition to consult.
        i - id of a unit in the coalition "c", must be included meanwhile [0;n[ where n is the number of units of this coalition (returned by getNumUnits).
        Returns:
        unit at the specified index on success.
        Throws:
        PPException - on errors linked with Prog&Play.
        See Also:
        getNumUnits(pp.PP.Coalition)
